definitions.definition: To give birth to a calf .
examples: The farmer could tell Bessie was about to calve .

definitions.definition: To assist in a cow’s giving birth to a calf.
examples: The farmer calved Bessie for almost two hours.

definitions.definition: To shed a large piece, e.g. an iceberg or a smaller block of ice (coming off an iceberg).
examples: The glacier was starting to calve even as we watched.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , figuratively , especially of an ice shelf , a glacier , an ice sheet , or even an iceberg

examples: The sea was dangerous because of icebergs calving off the nearby glacier.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , figuratively , especially of an iceberg

definitions.definition: To shed (a large piece, e.g. an iceberg ); to set loose (a mass of ice), e.g. a block of ice (coming off an iceberg).
examples: The glacier was starting to calve an iceberg even as we watched.
definitions.label_groups: transitive , figuratively , especially of an ice shelf , a glacier , an ice sheet , or even an iceberg

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To give birth to a calf .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To assist in a cow’s giving birth to a calf.
( transitive ) To give birth to (a calf ).
( intransitive , figuratively , especially of an ice shelf , a glacier , an ice sheet , or even an iceberg ) To shed a large piece, e.g. an iceberg or a smaller block of ice (coming off an iceberg).
( intransitive , figuratively , especially of an iceberg ) To break off.

( transitive , figuratively , especially of an ice shelf , a glacier , an ice sheet , or even an iceberg ) To shed (a large piece, e.g. an iceberg ); to set loose (a mass of ice), e.g. a block of ice (coming off an iceberg).
